title: US flags corruption as major business hurdle – The Times Group
summary:
The United States (US) State Department has said corruption remains a major obstacle to doing business in Malawi.

The United States (US) State Department has said corruption remains a major obstacle to doing business in Malawi.

In its 2025 Investment Climate Statement for Malawi, the US State Department notes that although some progress has been made to curb the vice, firms with US affiliations have reported irregularities in tender processes and mining licensing.

title: Stock exchange in slow February start

Investors took a cautious stance at the start of the new trading month.

title: Masters yet to give Mponda targets
summary:
Baka City owners, Masters Group of Companies, say management has not yet given their newly appointed head coach Peter Mponda targets.

title: Tobacco Demand Drops, Raising Concerns for Farmers and the Economy
summary:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also fal...
text_preview:
Malawi’s tobacco industry is facing a tough season. Preliminary reports show that buyers want to purchase only 170 million kilograms of tobacco in the 2025/26 season. This is 25 percent less than last year, when buyers bought 213 million kilograms.

The number of companies buying tobacco is also falling—from 11 last year to 8 this year. Experts warn that fewer buyers could push prices down, which ...

title: APM Delivers: Over 100,000 Tonnes of Maize from Zambia Begin Arriving in Malawi
summary:
President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

President Peter Mutharika is keeping his promise to fight hunger in Malawi as the first batch of 103,000 metric tonnes of maize—part of the 200,000MT procured from Zambia—begins entering the country through the Mchinji-Mwami border.

title: Nine Killed, 10 Injured in South Africa Tavern Mass Shooting

Police say the attack occurred around 1:00 a.m. on Sunday when about 12 unidentified gunmen arrived at the tavern in two vehicles and opened fire on patrons. Seven men and two women were killed in the attack.
